body: Looks like his is enabled by default when targeting C++20 in GCC, and by default in Clang, so I don't think there's a need to add this explicitly.
diff_hunk:

   AX_CHECK_COMPILE_FLAG([-Wunreachable-code-loop-increment], [WARN_CXXFLAGS="$WARN_CXXFLAGS -Wunreachable-code-loop-increment"], [], [$CXXFLAG_WERROR])

body: Isn't `tr` used to mark messages for translation? If yes, why is this needed here? If this is needed to convert to `QString`, why not call `QString{}` instead?

It's enabled by default in Clang, which should be good enough coverage for us.
In GCC, when targetting pre-C++20, it's enabled by `-Wenum-conversion`, which is part of `-Wextra`, which we already enable. Although in that case it may only be applied to C code.
diff_hunk:

body:
> Isn't `tr` used to mark messages for translation?

Yes, it is.

> If yes, why is this needed here? If this is needed to convert to `QString`, why not call `QString{}` instead?

No need for translation here. Updated in the recent push.

Thanks!

> I presume it is not enabled by default in C++17

Correct.

body:
> Do you have steps to reproduce?

No. I assumed Clang might be enabling with any standard, given they [don't specify otherwise](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/DiagnosticsReference.html#wdeprecated-enum-enum-conversion), like GCC does. However, I'm still a NACK on adding this. It's already enabled by default when it's needed, it's only available on fairly "new" compilers, so having everyone building with older ones check for availability is pointless, and I'd prefer that our configure checks don't return to being a grab-bag of checks for random flags. In any case, given the only existence of warning producing code, are a few instances in the GUI, I'd say the likelihood of any warning producing code being introduced is a also very low.
diff_hunk:

                         [AC_LANG_SOURCE([[struct A { virtual void f(); }; struct B : A { void f() final; };]])])

   AX_CHECK_COMPILE_FLAG([-Wimplicit-fallthrough], [WARN_CXXFLAGS="$WARN_CXXFLAGS -Wimplicit-fallthrough"], [], [$CXXFLAG_WERROR])

body:
0fea3846d0d6ec69dadd8bf043afd3c25971d07f

nit, here and below, use `QStringLiteral`, see https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qstring.html#more-efficient-string-construction

0fea3846d0d6ec69dadd8bf043afd3c25971d07f

`QObject::tr()`

Updated 38cffbb301e8d2ddf8dbc12afee99e76d8b54ebd -> 103b8dd8b89c772b7f6d097383e83d742b5ed55c ([pr24624.03](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr24624.03) -> [pr24624.04](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr24624.04), [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/compare/pr24624.03..pr24624.04)):

- addressed @promag's comments
Thanks! [Updated](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24624#issuecomment-1074850209).

The initial idea was to put this translation into the context named "QShortcut", rather "QObject". But context name does not go from `src/qt/locale/bitcoin_en.ts` into the Transifex environment. So [accepting](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24624#issuecomment-1074850209) your suggestion.
Can you explain why any of this needs translation? Is it displayed anywhere to the user?

> Can you explain why any of this needs translation? Is it displayed anywhere to the user?

![Screenshot from 2022-03-22 09-16-01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/159436822-65602247-4c09-44d8-acd3-e00368991f3a.png)

> An additional minor pro for adding this line is simplicity of testing this PR by reviewers using gcc.

I don't really think we should be adding warning flags to our build system for the sake of making testing PRs easier. If anyone wants to test this change, they can do `./configure CXXFLAGS="-Wdeprecated-enum-enum-conversion"` using a compiler that supports the option.

body:
Approach ACK acd98adaf1d83b71eda235c49d41a92f30c16313

For testing locally, #24169 will need to be merged. Edit: Or `./configure CXXFLAGS="-Wdeprecated-enum-enum-conversion"`, according to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24624#discussion_r832060992

> For testing locally, https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24169 will need to be merged.

Why? You can just do `./configure CXXFLAGS="-Wdeprecated-enum-enum-conversion"` with a supporting compiler.
